text: I am ready for the Russian ambassador.
Who did your make up?
We went for something dramatic. Do you like it?
You look like a badger.
Oh. Her eyes start to tear.
You're going to cry? Really? She stops her. They look in a mirror.
What do you think you look like?
(sadly) A badger. Sarah smiles ruefully.
And do you really think you can meet the Russian delegation looking like that? She shakes her head. SARAH (CONT’D) I will manage it. Go back to your rooms. She nods sadly.
Thank you. Sarah walks off. Anne walks back toward the Footman (3). looks straight ahead.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 10.
Did you just look at me! Did you?! He shakes his head no. Looks at the ground.
Do not avert your eyes! Shut them! He shuts them. She goes back into her rooms.

The busy, bustling kitchen. Maids scurry. Cooks cook. In a corner piles of Dishes and dirty caked on plates in front of her. Steaming hot water in troughs. Abigail work the dishes. Sally comes in carrying a bucket and brush.
Morning.
(bright and friendly) Oh hello. I was thinking of playing cards later if you would like to join me.
Sounds brill. The old bag says you are to scrub the floor until she can see her toothless fat face in it. She hands her the bucket full of liquid.
Sorry. Abigail shrugs. Gets down on her hands and knees. She plu her hand in the bucket. Intense pain shoots through her h She pulls it out.

You might need gloves. Lye is dangerous. It burns bad. Abigail writhes in pain. The girls laugh and saunter off she sticks her burning hand into a sink of cold water. i7 INT KITCHEN NIGHT i7 The kitchen is quiet. A few servants work but it’s late. Abigail works her way through the dishes in the near empt kitchen, the red raw pain in her hand excruciating. Mrs M rushes in. Sees Abigail.
(to Abigail) You! Get the bandage box! Abigail looks at her.
Hurry! The Queen’s had an attack of gout. Mrs Meg grabs a bucket covered with a white cloth. Abigail retrieves the bandage box.
Abigail follows Mrs Meg along a narrow corridor. Abigail juggles the bandage box and bucket.
They pass Footman (1). The doors open.
Abigail looks around as she enters the Queen’s rooms for first time. Piercing sobs draw Abigail’s attention. They enter the se darkened bedroom.

Anne is lying on the floor, her leg raised up on a chair. Sarah is there, examining Anne’s foot. Anne screams. Foot 1 brings a bottle of brandy past hurriedly. The QUEEN’S M stands by as the QUEEN’S DOCTOR examines her leg. Mrs. Meg motions to her, Abigail puts the bucket down. Sarah glances briefly at Abigail, The Doctor, who is layi leech on Anne’s leg. She flinches.
Sarah!
I’m here. I’m here. Brandy! She pushes a shot of brandy to Anne’s trembling lips. Abigail watches on.
They hurt.

I know my dearest I know. The beef! Mrs Meg uncovers the bucket to reveal thin slices of raw beef. Abigail starts laying the slices on her leg. Anne screams. SARAH (CONT’D) Gently cousin. Abigail nods. The Queen focuses on Abigail for a second, a new wave of pain comes on her. Anne closes her eyes grimacing.

(to Anne) It's alright. Tell me a story. (to Mrs Meg and the Doctor) You two may go. (to Abigail) You, start wrapping that. Mrs Meg and the Doctor nod and exit. Abigail wraps the le bandages. Anne, Sarah and Abigail are left there. But to Sarah it’s just her and Anne.
I... can’t. I...
How we first met. Tell me that. Come on. Anne struggles to focus, but tries.
The... wretched... Cheever boy had me down on the ground and was holding me... dropping spittle in my face.
He is still a pig. Then what? Blood leaks through some pores. She mops it up.
Then what?
I heard footsteps, fast footsteps, and saw these pink shoes running towards me...
Anne gulps brandy down. She is calming.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 13.
+. and then they disappeared and I heard a crack. And then he fell off
me, and I looked over and... ughh.
Remember how his jaw just hung there?
I do. You took my hand and said ‘Hello, I’m Sarah. You're covered in spittle. Let’s wash you off’. They laugh. Abigail is awkward at being present to this private moment.
You must try to sleep. Anne nods. She clasps Sarah’s hand.
(to Abigail) You may go. She goes.
Don’t leave.
I won't. Anne closes her eyes.
Are you still there?
Yes. Beat.
still?

Yes. Sarah touches Anne’s face, tenderly. 22 INT SERVANTS’ QUARTERS NIGHT 22 It's dark and cramped. Abigail is lying huddled in the corner. She raises her hand and unwraps the bandage to se it, blistered and sore.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 14. She looks around at the sleeping, farting, snoring bodies She can’t bear it.
Pre dawn. Abigail passes a sleeping groom by the stable d

A forested area. Abigail, one hand on the reins, races through the dawn light. She comes to a halt, breathless and happy for a moment. S dismounts the horse and scans the forest floor for a particular plant. Upon finding it, she breaks off some leaves. She crushes the leaves with a stone on another st and then unbandages her hand, places the pulp against her blisters and redresses her hand. She reaches down and bun together some more leaves before getting back on her hors Through the trees, she spies a handsome Equerry in his twenties, MASHAM. His eyes are closed and his head rests his horse's neck. He looks peaceful. Abigail watches him, transfixed. Suddenly his eyes blink open and he looks straight at her. She kicks her horse and shoots away.
Abigail walks up the stairs.
Abigail walks into the apartment. She sees the Footman 1 the night before guarding the door.
For the Queen. The doctor has ordered it immediately. It is a matter of extreme urgency
She's sleeping.
Shall I tell the doctor you imperiled the Queens health and let you rue the ramifications.
What does ramifi...mean.
It means he will have you whipped. He nods, waves a hand to let her through. She goes into t Queen's bedroom.

Anne lies sleeping, snoring slightly. Abigail examines he legs. They are still inflamed. She removes the dressing, pulls out the leaves she found on her ride and places the gently on her legs. Anne stirs a little. Sarah enters. Stares at her.
What are you doing?
I am... I... these are peleatis, the herb. I cut them this morning. They remove swelling and inflammation. I saw them and I thought it may help the Queen.
You cannot just walk in here! why did the footman let you through?

I lied to him. It is not his fault. I just wanted to help her. She seemed to suffer so much. Sarah sees a group of three military men, Godolphin and Marlborough enter at the far door. She nods to them.
Footman take her downstairs. Tell Mrs. Meg she is to receive six of the birch. Go! Abigail is stunned. She nods and walks with the footman 1 past the entering men. Sarah goes to the woozy Anne.
You must focus Anne. Much is at stake.
The maps are laid out across Anne’s legs, she struggles t focus. Marlborough has a pointer. He hits the map.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 16.
We gather forces here. The Austrians mass here. Anne focuses on the map.
Is that... which country again?
Listen! She hits the map with the pointer.
Marlborough.
This is the town of Lille, in a valley. We lure them in by sending a small force to engage them. They give chase. We descend in numbers from above them.
Hear hear. Others concur.
It is a brilliant plan. Queen Anne, you agree?
The people expect it to be over. Sarah takes her hand.
We all want it over, but wishing does not make it so Anne. We could sue for peace, but we will not get it.
It does help. They turn. Anne stirs. She sits up woozy, as if slightly drugged.
Something soothing on my legs, it takes the burn out. What is it?
Oh. Herbs. Of some sort.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 17. 29
It's nice. Thank you. She closes her eyes. Falls asleep. They stare at her.
The Footman 1 drags a struggling Abigail in, holding her her ear. The whole kitchen stops. Servants turn and watch
No! Please! He takes her to a side bench by the wall. Pushes her over
Do her in the barn if that is what is, not in my kitchen.

Her Ladyship says six of the birch for this one. Mrs Meg shrugs and nods. He pulls down the back of Abigail’s dress to reveal her b back. Mrs Meg goes to the corner and gets a hard stick of birch The other girls stand around eating biscuits, excited for show. Abigail focuses on a smiling Sally. Mrs Meg lifts her arm and lashes the birch across her bac Abigail flinches.
She really is a lady, look how soft that skin is. Mrs Meg pulls her arm back, strikes her again.
Stop! Sarah enters.
Let her up. Abigail stands. A welt starts forming across her back.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 18.
Follow me.
Sarah and Abigail in a small hallway off the kitchen.
So you are perhaps too kind for your own good.
It has been said.
Which leads to stupidity. But the Queen is soothed somewhat so I thank you. You shall get me more of those herbs. And not overstep again.
Yes Maam. My father always spoke highly of you.
I liked your father, he had charm to burn. And then I guess he did. Abigail nods. SARAH (CONT’D) You have fallen far.
Yes. When I was fifteen my father lost me in a card game.
You are not serious? Abigail Oh he was very upset about it. Took off into the forest with nothing but a scullery maid and a dozen bottles for solace.
And you went?
We honour our debts. They would have hurt him.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 19.
Foolish. A woman should not let herself be chattel.

I wanted to do right by my father. The debt was to a balloon shaped German man with a thin cock. Thankfully I managed to convince him a woman has her blood in twenty eight days a month. Sarah considers her, notices her bandage hand.
What happened to your hand?

Some of my colleagues are immune to my charms. 31 INT. ABIGAIL’S BEDROOM DAY 31 Mrs Meg opens a door. Abigail enters a cell like room containing a single bed, a small table and a wash basin. Abigail puts her battered bag on the floor. She can’t bel it. She is thrilled and bounces on the bed. Her own room. Mrs Meg leaves with a leer. Abigail goes and shuts the do and notices there is no lock.
Abigail, now dressed in a new dress, walks along the hall with Sarah. Sarah carries a document with the royal seal it. A chubby aristocrat, EARL STRATFORD, sees Sarah and h toward her.
Earl Stratford, do not come near me whining today or I will crush your tiny heart to liver. He backs off. A French woman elegantly dressed, MADAME TOURNEE.
Madame Tournee. You may have the tapestry budget you have asked for. Spend one penny more and I will take your finger nails in lieu.
Merci.
Abigail, get a platter of oysters sent to the Dutch Ambassador.
Yes your Ladyship. Masham steps into view.
Colonel Masham. He looks past Sarah and locks eyes with Abigail.
Lady Marlborough.
The Queen will ride on Tuesday morning.
Yes, Lady Marlborough. He loiters.
Would you like a bite of my new maid before you leave? He bows, a small smile exchanged between he and Abigail, departs. Sarah sees the smile between them.
Godolphin and Harley sit on couches smoking. Horatio sits next to Godolphin.
Must the duck be here?
Fastest duck in the city. Horatio is a prize worth stealing, he does not leave my side.
Keep him away from me or I will pull his liver out and eat it with a cornichon.
Charming.
You should know, I have canvassed my party. They are waiting for us to announce an attempt at peace.
We shall both make our case to the Queen. Harley stabs his pipe out, infuriated.
Where is the Queen? We have been waiting an hour. Sarah enters with Abigail.
I'm here.
Might I remind you, you are not the Queen.
She has sent me to speak for her. She is unwell. Abigail goes to a side table set with cakes. She cutting a piece.
What says she?
That Harley is a fop and a prat and smells like a ninety six year old French whore’s vajuju.
I really doubt you’re quoting.
She has decided to continue with the war. She feels another victory in will put us in a stronger position for a treaty. Her letters. She places a folded document with the royal seal table.
And how are we to pay for this? Abigail delivers the cake.
The Land tax is to be doubled. starts on the 21.
This is madness. The war you will be fighting will be in our own countryside.
She relies on you and your love of England to hold the Tories together.
There are limits.
To love of your country? To me there is no limit on that. Our last farthing to protect England if we must.
And our last man too? The dead pile up as do the resentments. Or that does not concern you?

I grieve them all, in my heart a scar for each, and I send my own beloved with them, chest bared. So do not lecture me on the cost. You do not count the cost in men until you need something heavy to toss on the scales with your greed.
A treaty would save money and lives. A win for all Englishman.
We go to them after one victory, they know we are scared. We bury more of them. They know we have them. The Queen has decided Harley.
I disagree...a lot! I would like an audience with her where I may state my case.
State it to me, I love a comedy. Is there cake? Harley stares at her, disbelievingly.
This is a disgusting distortion of the system. You have no place in this!

Your mascara is running. If you'd like to go fix yourself we can continue this later. Harley kicks a small table across the room. He is exasperated, spittle flying. Abigail is thrilled by the w thing.
You will need to pay for the repair of that. We have a war to finance. Every penny counts.

(to Harley) Come on, old bean. One more victory. Otherwise they will use the time it takes for a treaty negotiation to regroup. Mark my words. Harley ignores him, just staring angrily at Sarah. Sudden Harley runs at Sarah, stopping just in front of her. She doesn’t flinch. His breath is ragged, she breathes calmly breaks and storms from the room. GODOLPHIN (CONT’D) Must you rub it in? A man’s dignity is the thing that holds him back from running amok.
Sometimes a lady likes to have fun. Godolphin eyes Sarah.
We need to be careful Sarah. He is a useful ally and a dangerous enemy. Godolphin exits. A wide eyed Abigail.
You are... extraordinary. A woman like no other.
And you are astute and perspicacious. And perhaps something of a flatterer.
It is not flattery when it is fact. You are not scared of anyone.
Of course not.
Abigail walks the hallway. Sees Masham. She follows him f bit. He turns around suddenly and looks at her.
Are you following me? Abigail turns on her heel and walks back the way she came He follows.
I said are you following me?
You seem to be following me, sir, as I am in front of you.
That was you on the horse this morning.
I ama servant, where would I get a horse? Perhaps you dreamt of me?
Perhaps it was you and I should have you stripped and whipped.

I’m waiting. She stares at him challengingly. He smiles, but doesn’t m She suddenly breaks off and heads into the backstairs.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 25. Harley walks in from another room. Sees Masham.
Going to ride that one are we?
She does make my blood hot. She is Lady Marlborough’s new one.
Indeed. Interesting.
Sarah walks and finds Abigail looking at her books.
Borrow anything you want.
Thank you. And thank you for the job.
I have a thing for the weak. Marlborough comes to the door. Sarah turns and looks at h
It is time. She nods. Then rushes to Marlborough and embraces him, holding him tightly.
You must be safe. You must not be foolish and brave. Be smart and safe. I beg you.
I will.
Stay with me tonight.
I must sleep with my men. It is only right. She nods. He kisses her softly on the lips.

head_text.subj: INT PALACE COURTYARD / GREAT HALL AFTERNOON 37

text: Anne and Sarah stand at the window looking down on A line HIGH RANKING military men on black horses. Marlborough ra a hand of farewell to them. Abigail stands by the door.
I had a dream that this very small Frenchman covered in blood, was carrying his head around feeding it brie. Anne pinches her hand. They look at each other.
He is a great soldier. Sarah composes herself.
He will be fine. We will prevail.
Of course we will Mrs Freeman. Anne walks away toward the door. Abigail coughs loudly as she reaches her. Attracting a lo from Anne.
I am sorry Your Majesty. I think I caught a chill picking the herbs for your leg.
That was you?
Abigail. Anne nods. Heads past her and out. Sarah watches the horses disappear. Turns around. Sees Abigail.
Let’s shoot something.
A large cage full of cooing pigeons. Inside it a PIGEON B waits for his cue.

Throw!  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 27. He releases a pigeon and it flies through the air. A guns and it drops to the ground. Sarah smiles, satisfied. At her feet, a pile of dead bird The dogs retrieve the latest. She looks across at Abigail has a gun.
It's sad really. They are so pretty.
Learn to fly faster, pretty will not save you bird.
‘Throw! A bird is released, Abigail raises her weapon and misses
You're really doing damage to the sky.
Can I ask you something?
As long as you are aware I have a gun.
You fought hard for this war and your husband is at the front of it, his life at risk. How can you ... do that?

It is right. If we don’t do it they will gather force and be over here cutting us all into chops within the year. You are of a sweet disposition and have had some blows so desire safety and favour above all else.
If he dies?
Did you not sacrifice your cunt to fatty German to save your father?
Yes.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 28.
There’s always a price to pay. I am prepared to pay it. Throw! The bird flies, she shoots it down. Stares across at Abig
Just relax and aim. When it crosses your eye, pull the trigger.
Throw! Abigail lines up the shot, shoots and brings it down. She smiles weakly, pleased yet sad.
Yes! Perfect! I will make a killer of you yet.

A pair of bandaged legs in gold sequined stockings. Anne wheeled into the ballroom by a Footman (4) on a brocaded throne chair with wheels. The ballroom is thronged with people. People bow as she enters. She greets them. The wheels are chocked with little wooden chocks. Harley makes a beeline for her.
Your Majesty. How lovely to see you. It seems you have allocated even more money into the abyss that is this fool's errand.
Oh. Yes. We... will win. Sarah is sure we will win.
This landholders tax. You have no idea the fire storm of rage you have set loose in the countryside.
Really? They are angry? Sarah arrives.
Dearest Queen. Anne smiles at Sarah.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 29.
How do you like the stockings?
Festive.
I was just explaining to the Queen the mistake this tax is, and the war as well. We should sue for peace.
Oh Harley, you're such a bore. That is for parliament. A ball is for dancing and eating these venison and horseradish puffs. Have you tried these?
I am having trouble swallowing at the moment. Your Majesty-
I would like to enjoy the music now.
Of course. Sarah winks at Harley. He walks away. The orchestra strik up.

Oh I love this music. I must dance. Sarah leaves Anne and walks to the centre of the room. Sh stands scanning the crowd who naturally stop talking and her attention. She raises her hand and slowly moves it ov the crowd, finally stopping on Masham.

You. A small smattering of applause as he heads to her. The music begins. The dancing begins. A fast paced waltz. little bit idiosyncratic, legs fly. Anne is thrilled, watching their slick leg work and fast moves. Then she saddens at the sight of her useless balloon like legs lai out in front of her, a little new blood seeping through h sequined stockings.
Stop it. Stop! The music stops suddenly. Sarah looks at Anne.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 30.
I would like to go back to my room now!
What has happened?
Now! The Footman (3) starts to wheel her away. People are star Anne sees Harley.
stop! Mr Harley, I agree I went too far with the tax for the war.
What?!
We shall keep it as it was. Sarah's eyes blaze. Harley smiles and bows. Sarah takes o pushing from the footman.
We are your servants my Queen.
Sarah wheels Anne along. When they are alone, Sarah spins the wheelchair around.
Anne, I’m sorry. Anne slaps her hard across the face.
It's okay. Anne nods. They smile at each other. SARAH (CONT’D) Shall we go fast? She runs with the chair, Anne shrieks and squeals.

Abigail climbs the ladder to the bookshelf. She slides a in and pulls a new one out.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 31. Hears the door open. Sees Anne’s wheelchair whiz in and c into the wall. Sarah follows behind. Abigail freezes.

Give me your finger. Sarah does so. Anne puts it in her mouth. Sucks it for a second then bites it hard. Abigail’s eyes widen. She watches as Anne releases her bite, grabs Sarah, pulls face to hers, kissing her hard and passionately on the mo Abigail almost falls off the ladder, but stays up. Hangs
Fuck me. Sarah nods. She wheels her through to the bedroom. Across the way, Abigail stands rigid on the ladder. She breathes out. Drops to the floor. Starts to creep out as quietly as possible.
Abigail clutching a book, in a daze starts to walk down t stairway. Harley suddenly stands before her.
Abigail isn’t it?
Yes sir,...
Stole a book I see. Why, one could be stripped and whipped for that.
My mistress lent it to me.
Shall we go ask her?
No! Harley is satisfied he has something over her.
Come and take the night air with me. She is a little scared but follows him.
Harley walks with Abigail across the lawn. The lights of castle behind them.
So you once were a lady and now you are a nothing, a bit of scullery scraps. How very sad.
I am still the lady I was. In my heart.
No doubt. It is important to make new friends is it not?
Yes. If that is what is actually happening here, and not veiled threats under the guise of civility. Harley laughs.
Am I to understand you are smart?
You want something. To fuck me?
I will leave that to my friend Masham, who is completely cuntstruck by you. So tell me about Lady Marlborough, Godolphin, the Queen. Anything going on? I love gossip. It’s a failing I know.
Lady Marlborough has been good to me, she has saved me. I will not breach her confidence.

Of course. You are in favour. But favour is a breeze that shifts direction all the time. Then in an instant you're back sleeping with a bunch of scabrous whores wondering whose finger’s in your arse. You cannot have too many friends in court. I need a friend Abigail, one with cute ears and wide eyes. I am often blind-sided by the distorted situation at court. As Leader of the Opposition I should not be. (MORE)
I would merely like to know of any plans her Ladyship, Godolphin or the Queen may have.
I will not betray my mistress’s trust.
Oh look a wren. How cute. She looks to the trees. Harley trips her and she goes fac first into the stony path.
Are you alright? Let me help you up. He reaches down. She warily reaches out a hand and he pul her up a little.
Thing is if you're not my friend. You are.. Then suddenly lets her go, she falls back down.
++ by definition my enemy. Anyway, think on it. No pressure. Harley stalks off. Abigail sees the little wren, lying de on the ground beside the path.
Morning. Abigail pours hot chocolate into two cups on a t Anne lying on a sofa. And Sarah on a chair.
You will have to tell Harley you have changed your mind about the tax.
can’t you do that?
I am not the Queen.
.+.are the people really angry about the land tax?  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 34.
They'll be angrier when the French are sodomising their wives and planting their fields with garlic.
The Tories must not be rode roughshod over though. And...more dead if we do it.

It is painful to lose men, but we cannot be half hearted in this or they will see our weakness and take us and we will lose thousands more. We must be strong Anne. It hangs in the balance and the tipping point is courage. Abigail approaches with the hot chocolate. SARAH (CONT’D) None for the Queen.
What?
You cannot have hot chocolate. Your stomach, the sugar inflames it.
Abigail hand me the cup.
Do not. Abigail is frozen.
I’m sorry, I do not know what tor...
Fine, give it to her, and then go get a bucket and a mop for the aftermath. Anne takes it, but does not drink it. Sits with it. Abiga exits.
Take me back. She gets in her chair. Sarah goes across and unlocks the panel to the secret passage.
Sarah wheels Anne.
You will pronounce the tax in parliament. I will set the date. Anne nods. They stop. Sarah unlocks the door. Shuts the door and heads back up the passage.
45 Rolls Anne in. 46 A suit of armour. A shot is fired banging into it, an arm falls to the ground. At a distance Sarah and Abigail. Sarah reloads her pistol using the gun powder funnel.
I must tell you something.
Go on.
Mr Harley came to me. He asked me to betray your confidences, about what goes on between you and the Queen and Godolphin.
I see. And what will you do?
I... am not going to! Obviously.
Not obviously. You may tell me of his approach to encourage my trust and still work both sides of the street.
(outraged) I am a person of honour even if my station is not. Even if I were to be the last one left in this wretched place, I would remain a lady! Sarah laughs.
You are pretty when outraged. So my secrets are safe with you?
All of them.
Good.
Even your biggest secret. Sarah looks up at Abigail, who smiles knowingly. She clos her gun.
Abigail. Sarah rises her gun. Shoots. Abigail falls. Sarah starts laughing. A terrified Abigail lies on the ground, checking herself wounds. Sarah's smiling face appears suddenly above her.
If you forget to load the pellet the gun fires, makes the sound, but releases no shot. It is a great jape do you agree?
Yes.. great.
Maybe we will think of some use for it one day. Sometimes it is hard to remember if you have loaded the pellet or not. I do fear confusion and accidents.
I’m sure people will be careful.
Anne drops lettuce leaves into the enclosure for her rabb She watches them for a moment. She’s bored.

Anne sits alone, a big cake with blue icing half eaten be her as she plays solitaire. She takes another piece of ca her lips blue from the icing. She feels ill suddenly. Mak noise. Lady in waiting is ready with a bucket, she rushes over w and Anne throws up into it.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 37. 49 50 51 Footman (2) enters with a mop. Lady in waiting dabs at he lips with a linen. Anne pushes her away.
Anne on a crutch limps along the passageway.
Anne enters but the apartment is empty.
A full office, crammed with people and activity. Sarah is maintaining order, just. Sarah is at the desk, entering figures in the ledger. Abigail in the background.
Twelve guineas for beef. She is rewarded with a nod. Harley watches on, seated to right of Sarah.
Madame Tournee. Madame Tournee steps forward.
The Winter Ball. Your expenses are out of control! Madame Tournee Madame is an artiste and art is like a cloud, it floats and gathers force as it must before it rains joy.
Let it rain at the cost of eight guineas instead of fifty.
But... Sarah looks to her ledger, ignoring Madame Tournee.
Cream. Mrs Meg your cream bill is outrageous. Are you bathing in it to help your hemorrhoids?
No your Ladyship.  THE FAVOURITE SHOOTING SCRIPT 6 MAR 17 38. 52
May I examine?
Of course. Harley looks down the ledger. He nods reluctantly.
Perfect Lady Marlborough. As always.

Shall we sign off? He nods. He signs the ledger. As does she. PAGE BOY 2, a young boy of fifteen, comes in and whispers Sarah. INT ANNE’S APARTMENTS DAY 52 Sarah enters to find Anne standing on a window sill. She leans out dangerously, the wind pulls at her.
Aim for the flagstones. The lawn may break your fall.
You do not care!
Mrs Morley. Please. Sarah goes to her. Grabs her suddenly by the back of the and yanks her inside. She lands on her arse.
Ow! Just stay for a little while! No! Take the day off. I command it.
Someone must run things! (plaintively) I am not food! You cannot just eat and eat! Anne grabs Sarah by the forearm and bites her.
(playfully) And yet you are tasty. And licks her.
And salty. And if I grilled you, you would make a delightful meal.
You are... incorrigible. Beat.
Fine. I will come and play whist with you this afternoon. Anne smiles and claps her hands. Sarah, resigned, turns a leaves.
The Tories stomp their feet heavily drowning out Godolphi he tries to speak.

The opposition asks us to be halfhearted in this war! We will not! We must wear our griefs for England is worth our all, and suffer we must to save her! Mr Harley control your rabble! Sarah watches on. Sarah scribbles down a note and hands i pageboy 2.
INT GOLDEN HALLWAY AFTERNOON 54a Abigail walks through into the Queen’s apartment. She moves past the two Footmen (1-3) into

There stands a table, set up, cards at the ready. A bottl champagne and glasses. A low growling sound comes from the next room. The Queen stands at a table and is stretching her leg in a ballet m and growling in pain. Abigail watches the Queen from the salon doorway. Anne se someone coming.
